languages.text: "Сначала выскажутся ответчики, после вы можете задать мне уточняющие вопросы по делу, а затем..." {n}Старуха многозначительно смотрит на вас поверх окуляров.{/n} "Надлежит вынести смертный приговор. Разумеется, вы вправе рассудить иначе, но казнь предпочтительней: в тяжбах, что вы рассмотрите, едва ли будут исходы без болезненных последствий. Казнь уменьшает число недовольных и подталкивает будущих ответчиков решать свои проблемы, не доводя дело до суда Вольного Торговца".

"The defendants will speak first, whereupon you can ask me clarifying questions on the case, and then—" {n}The old woman gives you a meaningful look over her ocular lenses.{/n} "—a death sentence must be passed. You are, of course, free to judge otherwise, but an execution is preferable, since in every case that will come before you, an outcome without highly unpleasant consequences is unlikely. Executions reduce the number of malcontents and motivate prospective defendants to solve their problems before they come under the purview of the Rogue Trader's court."
languages.original_text: "Сначала выскажутся ответчики, после вы можете задать мне уточняющие вопросы по делу, а затем..." {n}Старуха многозначительно смотрит на вас поверх окуляров.{/n} "Надлежит вынести смертный приговор. Разумеется, вы вправе рассудить иначе, но казнь предпочтительней: в тяжбах, что вы рассмотрите, едва ли будут исходы без болезненных последствий. Казнь уменьшает число недовольных и подталкивает будущих ответчиков решать свои проблемы, не доводя дело до суда Вольного Торговца".

languages.text: "Zuerst sprechen die Beschuldigten, dann könnt Ihr mir klärende Fragen zu dem Fall stellen, und schließlich ..." {n}Die alte Frau wirft dir durch ihre Okularlinsen einen bedeutungsvollen Blick zu.{/n} "... muss ein Todesurteil gefällt werden. Ihr könnt natürlich anders urteilen, aber eine Hinrichtung wäre zu bevorzugen, denn bei jedem Fall, der Euch vorgelegt wird, ist ein Ergebnis ohne hochgradig unangenehme Konsequenzen unwahrscheinlich. Hinrichtungen verringern die Anzahl der Unzufriedenen und motivieren künftige Beschuldigte, ihre Probleme selbst zu lösen, bevor sie in den Zuständigkeitsbereich des Gerichts {mf|des Freihändlers|der Freihändlerin} gelangen."
languages.original_text: "The defendants will speak first, whereupon you can ask me clarifying questions on the case, and then—" {n}The old woman gives you a meaningful look over her ocular lenses.{/n} "—a death sentence must be passed. You are, of course, free to judge otherwise, but an execution is preferable, since in every case that will come before you, an outcome without highly unpleasant consequences is unlikely. Executions reduce the number of malcontents and motivate prospective defendants to solve their problems before they come under the purview of the Rogue Trader's court."

traits.locale_text: "Zuerst sprechen die Beschuldigten, dann könnt Ihr mir klärende Fragen zu dem Fall stellen, und schließlich ..." {n}Die alte Frau wirft dir durch ihre Okularlinsen einen bedeutungsvollen Blick zu.{/n} "... muss ein Todesurteil gefällt werden. Ihr könnt natürlich anders urteilen, aber eine Hinrichtung wäre zu bevorzugen, denn bei jedem Fall, der Euch vorgelegt wird, ist ein Ergebnis ohne hochgradig unangenehme Konsequenzen unwahrscheinlich. Hinrichtungen verringern die Anzahl der Unzufriedenen und motivieren künftige Beschuldigte, ihre Probleme selbst zu lösen, bevor sie in den Zuständigkeitsbereich des Gerichts {mf|des Freihändlers|der Freihändlerin} gelangen."

languages.text: « Les plaignants prendront la parole en premier, après quoi vous pourrez me demander des éclaircissements sur l'affaire en question. Ensuite... » {n}La vieille femme vous adresse un regard éloquent, par-dessus ses lorgnons mécaniques.{/n} « ... une peine de mort devra être prononcée. Bien entendu, vous êtes libre d'en décider autrement, mais toutes les affaires soumises à votre jugement appelant un verdict implacable, une exécution reste préférable. Voyez-vous, les exécutions ont l'avantage de réduire le nombre de mécontents et d'inciter les éventuels requérants à régler leurs litiges par leurs propres moyens, avant de devoir comparaître devant la cour {mf|du libre-marchand|de la libre-marchande}. »
languages.original_text: "The defendants will speak first, whereupon you can ask me clarifying questions on the case, and then—" {n}The old woman gives you a meaningful look over her ocular lenses.{/n} "—a death sentence must be passed. You are, of course, free to judge otherwise, but an execution is preferable, since in every case that will come before you, an outcome without highly unpleasant consequences is unlikely. Executions reduce the number of malcontents and motivate prospective defendants to solve their problems before they come under the purview of the Rogue Trader's court."

traits.locale_text: « Les plaignants prendront la parole en premier, après quoi vous pourrez me demander des éclaircissements sur l'affaire en question. Ensuite... » {n}La vieille femme vous adresse un regard éloquent, par-dessus ses lorgnons mécaniques.{/n} « ... une peine de mort devra être prononcée. Bien entendu, vous êtes libre d'en décider autrement, mais toutes les affaires soumises à votre jugement appelant un verdict implacable, une exécution reste préférable. Voyez-vous, les exécutions ont l'avantage de réduire le nombre de mécontents et d'inciter les éventuels requérants à régler leurs litiges par leurs propres moyens, avant de devoir comparaître devant la cour {mf|du libre-marchand|de la libre-marchande}. »

languages.text: “先由涉事双方进行发言，之后您可以询问我关于案件的问题，进一步澄清事实。在此之后——”{n}老妇人的目光透过镜片，意味深长地看着你。{/n}“——您必须宣判死刑。当然，您确实有权做出其他裁断，但死刑是更加建议的结果。因为在此之前宣判的所有案件，有罪的一方都承担了极其严重的后果。死刑可以减少涉事人员的数量，也可以让所有潜在涉事人员意识到：他们最好能自行解决彼此之间的纠纷，不要将事态升级到需要行商浪人亲自审判的地步。”
languages.original_text: "The defendants will speak first, whereupon you can ask me clarifying questions on the case, and then—" {n}The old woman gives you a meaningful look over her ocular lenses.{/n} "—a death sentence must be passed. You are, of course, free to judge otherwise, but an execution is preferable, since in every case that will come before you, an outcome without highly unpleasant consequences is unlikely. Executions reduce the number of malcontents and motivate prospective defendants to solve their problems before they come under the purview of the Rogue Trader's court."

traits.locale_text: “先由涉事双方进行发言，之后您可以询问我关于案件的问题，进一步澄清事实。在此之后——”{n}老妇人的目光透过镜片，意味深长地看着你。{/n}“——您必须宣判死刑。当然，您确实有权做出其他裁断，但死刑是更加建议的结果。因为在此之前宣判的所有案件，有罪的一方都承担了极其严重的后果。死刑可以减少涉事人员的数量，也可以让所有潜在涉事人员意识到：他们最好能自行解决彼此之间的纠纷，不要将事态升级到需要行商浪人亲自审判的地步。”

languages.text: «Los acusados hablarán primero, luego, usted podrá pedirme más detalles sobre el caso y, después...». {n}La anciana te dedica una mirada significativa por encima de sus lentes oculares.{/n} «Deberá dictar una sentencia de muerte. Es libre de dictar otra sentencia, por supuesto, pero la ejecución es preferible, ya que cualquier caso que llegue hasta usted tendrá consecuencias desagradables con casi toda seguridad. Las ejecuciones reducen el número de insatisfechos y animan a los futuros acusados a resolver sus problemas antes de que lleguen al tribunal de{mf|l| la} Comerciante Independiente».
languages.original_text: "The defendants will speak first, whereupon you can ask me clarifying questions on the case, and then—" {n}The old woman gives you a meaningful look over her ocular lenses.{/n} "—a death sentence must be passed. You are, of course, free to judge otherwise, but an execution is preferable, since in every case that will come before you, an outcome without highly unpleasant consequences is unlikely. Executions reduce the number of malcontents and motivate prospective defendants to solve their problems before they come under the purview of the Rogue Trader's court."

traits.locale_text: «Los acusados hablarán primero, luego, usted podrá pedirme más detalles sobre el caso y, después...». {n}La anciana te dedica una mirada significativa por encima de sus lentes oculares.{/n} «Deberá dictar una sentencia de muerte. Es libre de dictar otra sentencia, por supuesto, pero la ejecución es preferible, ya que cualquier caso que llegue hasta usted tendrá consecuencias desagradables con casi toda seguridad. Las ejecuciones reducen el número de insatisfechos y animan a los futuros acusados a resolver sus problemas antes de que lleguen al tribunal de{mf|l| la} Comerciante Independiente».

languages.text: 「被告人が最初に発言します。その後、あなたはこの事件について私に確認の質問をすることができます。そして…」{n}老女は眼鏡越しに意味ありげな視線をあなたに向けた。{/n}「…死刑判決を下さねばなりません。もちろんあなたは別の判断を下す自由がありますが、処刑が望ましいのです。なぜなら、あなたの前に持ち込まれるいかなる事件でも、非常に不快な結果を伴わない結末はほとんどありえないからです。処刑は不満分子の数を減らし、将来の被告候補者たちに、彼らの問題がローグトレーダーの裁判の管轄に入る前に、自分で問題を解決するように動機を与えます」
languages.original_text: "The defendants will speak first, whereupon you can ask me clarifying questions on the case, and then—" {n}The old woman gives you a meaningful look over her ocular lenses.{/n} "—a death sentence must be passed. You are, of course, free to judge otherwise, but an execution is preferable, since in every case that will come before you, an outcome without highly unpleasant consequences is unlikely. Executions reduce the number of malcontents and motivate prospective defendants to solve their problems before they come under the purview of the Rogue Trader's court."

traits.locale_text: 「被告人が最初に発言します。その後、あなたはこの事件について私に確認の質問をすることができます。そして…」{n}老女は眼鏡越しに意味ありげな視線をあなたに向けた。{/n}「…死刑判決を下さねばなりません。もちろんあなたは別の判断を下す自由がありますが、処刑が望ましいのです。なぜなら、あなたの前に持ち込まれるいかなる事件でも、非常に不快な結果を伴わない結末はほとんどありえないからです。処刑は不満分子の数を減らし、将来の被告候補者たちに、彼らの問題がローグトレーダーの裁判の管轄に入る前に、自分で問題を解決するように動機を与えます」

languages.text: "İlk olarak sanıklar konuştuktan sonra bana davaya ilişkin sorular sorabilirsiniz. Ardından da..." {n}Yaşlı kadın, oküler merceklerinin ardından anlamlı bir bakış atıyor.{/n} "Ölüm cezası verilmesi gerekir. Başka bir karar verebilirsiniz elbette. Ancakk tatsız sonuçlara yol açmayacak bir karar vermek her davada mümkün olmayacağından ölüm cezası, tercih edilebilir bir seçenektir. İnfazlar, mevzubahis davada hoşnutsuz tarafların sayısını azaltmakla birlikte olası sanıkları da yaşadıkları sorunu Hür Tacir'in yargısına gerek kalmadan çözmeye teşvik eder."
languages.original_text: "The defendants will speak first, whereupon you can ask me clarifying questions on the case, and then—" {n}The old woman gives you a meaningful look over her ocular lenses.{/n} "—a death sentence must be passed. You are, of course, free to judge otherwise, but an execution is preferable, since in every case that will come before you, an outcome without highly unpleasant consequences is unlikely. Executions reduce the number of malcontents and motivate prospective defendants to solve their problems before they come under the purview of the Rogue Trader's court."

traits.locale_text: "İlk olarak sanıklar konuştuktan sonra bana davaya ilişkin sorular sorabilirsiniz. Ardından da..." {n}Yaşlı kadın, oküler merceklerinin ardından anlamlı bir bakış atar.{/n} "Ölüm cezası verilmesi gerekir. Başka bir karar verebilirsiniz elbette, lakin tatsız sonuçlara yol açmayacak bir karar vermek her davada mümkün olmayacağından ölüm cezası tercih edilebilir bir seçenektir. İnfazlar, mevzubahis davada hoşnutsuz tarafların sayısını azaltmakla birlikte olası sanıkları da yaşadıkları sorunu Hür Tacir'in yargısına gerek kalmadan çözmeye teşvik eder."
